intro: Endiandra subtriplinervis, commonly known as the three-veined endiandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Dipterocarpaceae. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves with three prominent veins, giving it its scientific name. It typically grows as a small to medium-sized tree, reaching heights of up to 20 meters. The flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in yellow or greenish-yellow hues, and are pollinated by insects.
